Animal Name: American Alligator
Scientific Name: Alligator mississippiensis
IUCN Conservation Status: Least Concern 
Habitats: Freshwater habitats in the southeastern United States 
Countries: United States 
Summary: The American alligator is a reptile that can reach up to 13 feet in length and weigh nearly 500 pounds. They are opportunistic predators that feed on a variety of prey items, including fish, turtles, snakes, mammals, and birds.
